meanings.definition: A package containing two items or components.
meanings.sent1: I bought a bipack of pens at the store.
meanings.sent2: The store sells a bipack of batteries for a good price.
meanings.sent3: The bipack of socks was so cute, I had to buy it.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like a bipack of precious gems.
meanings.sent5: The bipack of cupcakes looked too delicious to resist.

meanings.definition: To package or wrap items in a set of two.
meanings.sent1: She will bipack the gifts for the party.
meanings.sent2: The company will bipack the products for shipping.
meanings.sent3: He bipacked the sandwiches neatly for the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The artist bipacked the paintings carefully for the exhibition.
meanings.sent5: They bipack the books in matching covers for display.
